New Records: Mexico won 3-0 against New Zealand, with Pineda scoring in the 5th minute, Huerta in the 53rd minute, and Romo in the 57th minute
Key Match Events: Mexico dominated the match with 13 shots to 2, New Zealand's defense kept them tame, Santiago Gimenez had a night to forget, and New Zealand registered their first effort on target in the 70th minute
Pre-Game Insights: Mexico's new manager Javier Aguirre began his third stint in charge of the team, and a new group of talent played without Guillermo Ochoa, Edson Álvarez, Raúl Jiménez, or Hirving “Chucky” Lozano on the roster
Post-Match Reflections: Aguirre praised his team's performance, and the win marked a good start to his third stint in charge of the team
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Rose Bowl, and the sparse crowd witnessed one-way traffic in favor of Mexico
